    • Method Detail

      • scan

        public Syntax scan()
            throws IOException
        This function parses preprocessor directives. The directive must occur at the beginning of the new line, which is why we must keep a flag indicating whether this is so. The function returns either the next Yytoken from the lexer or a Directive which the function has parsed. The directive's location is taken from the location of the hash symbol.
        Specified by:
        scan in interface Stream
        Returns:
        the next token or compound token.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • done

        public boolean done()
        Description copied from interface: Stream
        Indicates the stream is over.
        Specified by:
        done in interface Stream
        Returns:
        true if the stream is over.
